Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Emotional Damage)

result.execSummary:
All charges against Manuel F Rodrigues in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Manuel F Rodrigues is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Stipulation and Order for Dismissal signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 4/21/22
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Dismissal
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A and Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Caretaker must participate in any contact with Victim A or Victim B.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  Court orders the defendant to CAM monitoring.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

09:41 AM Defendant Manuel F Rodrigues in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for arraginment and for a bail hearing.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Defense gives arguments regarding bail.  State gives arguments regarding bail.  
For the reasons stated on the record the Court declines to modify amount of bail.
Defense requests a modification to the no contact condition in the bond.  Arguments by the Defense.  Arguments by the State.
Court orders the conditions of bond modified to allow contact with Victim A and Victim B.  Caretaker must participate in any contact with Victim A or Victim B.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date as soon as the court can accommodate.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:37 AM Defendant Manuel F Rodrigues in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McMahon states they are withdrawing their motion to dismiss as there are current negotiations with the State and are prepared to proceed with a waiver of preliminary hearing today.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney McMahon requests this be set for an arraignment on the next date before the Trial Court.  Bail remains as fixed.  The Court will set this matter for an arraignment on the date of the bail hearing on March 2, 2022 at 9:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
